 2298: t_tuple_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2299:     10 = do_tuple_size({1,2,3,4}),
 2300:     fc(catch do_tuple_size({1,2,3})),
 2301:     fc(catch do_tuple_size(42)),
 2302: 
 2303:     error = ludicrous_tuple_size({a,b,c}),
 2304:     error = ludicrous_tuple_size([a,b,c]),
 2305: 
 2306:     good_ip({1,2,3,4}),
 2307:     good_ip({1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8}),
 2308:     error = validate_ip({42,11}),
 2309:     error = validate_ip(atom),
 2310:     
 2311:     ok.
 2312: 
 2313: do_tuple_size(T) when tuple_size(T) =:= 4 ->
 2314:     {A,B,C,D} = T,
 2315:     A+B+C+D.
 2316: 
 2317: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 2318:   when tuple_size(T) =:= 16#7777777777777777777777777777777777 -> ok;
 2319: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 2320:   when tuple_size(T) =:= 16#10000000000000000 -> ok;
 2321: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 2322:   when tuple_size(T) =:= (1 bsl 64) - 1 -> ok;
 2323: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 2324:   when tuple_size(T) =:= 16#FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF -> ok;
 2325: ludicrous_tuple_size(_) -> error.
 2326: 
 2327: good_ip(IP) ->
 2328:     IP = validate_ip(IP).
 2329: 
 2330: validate_ip(Value) when is_tuple(Value) andalso
 2331:                         ((size(Value) =:= 4) orelse (size(Value) =:= 8)) ->
 2332:     %% size/1 (converted to tuple_size) used more than once.
 2333:     Value;
 2334: validate_ip(_) ->
 2335:     error.
 2336: 
 2337: %%
 2338: %% The binary_part/2,3 guard BIFs
 2339: %%
 2340: -define(MASK_ERROR(EXPR),mask_error((catch (EXPR)))).
 2341: mask_error({'EXIT',{Err,_}}) ->
 2342:     Err;
 2343: mask_error(Else) ->
 2344:     Else.
 2345: 
 2346: %% Test the binary_part/2,3 guard (GC) BIFs.
 2347: binary_part(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2348:     %% This is more or less a copy of what the guard_SUITE in emulator
 2349:     %% does to cover the guard bif's
 2350:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>),
 2351:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>),
 2352:     error = bptest(<<1>>),
 2353:     error = bptest(<<>>),
 2354:     error = bptest(apa),
 2355:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>),
 2356:     % With one variable (pos)
 2357:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>,1),
 2358:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>,1),
 2359:     error = bptest(<<1>>,1),
 2360:     error = bptest(<<>>,1),
 2361:     error = bptest(apa,1),
 2362:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>,1),
 2363:     % With one variable (length)
 2364:     1 = bptesty(<<1,2,3>>,1),
 2365:     2 = bptesty(<<2,1,3>>,1),
 2366:     error = bptesty(<<1>>,1),
 2367:     error = bptesty(<<>>,1),
 2368:     error = bptesty(apa,1),
 2369:     3 = bptesty(<<2,3,3>>,2),
 2370:     % With one variable (whole tuple)
 2371:     1 = bptestx(<<1,2,3>>,{1,1}),
 2372:     2 = bptestx(<<2,1,3>>,{1,1}),
 2373:     error = bptestx(<<1>>,{1,1}),
 2374:     error = bptestx(<<>>,{1,1}),
 2375:     error = bptestx(apa,{1,1}),
 2376:     3 = bptestx(<<2,3,3>>,{1,2}),
 2377:     % With two variables
 2378:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>,1,1),
 2379:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>,1,1),
 2380:     error = bptest(<<1>>,1,1),
 2381:     error = bptest(<<>>,1,1),
 2382:     error = bptest(apa,1,1),
 2383:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>,1,2),
 2384:     % Direct (autoimported) call, these will be evaluated by the compiler...
 2385:     <<2>> = binary_part(<<1,2,3>>,1,1),
 2386:     <<1>> = binary_part(<<2,1,3>>,1,1),
 2387:     % Compiler warnings due to constant evaluation expected (3)
 2388:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(<<1>>,1,1)),
 2389:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(<<>>,1,1)),
 2390:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(apa,1,1)),
 2391:     <<3,3>> = binary_part(<<2,3,3>>,1,2),
 2392:     % Direct call through apply
 2393:     <<2>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<1,2,3>>,1,1]),
 2394:     <<1>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<2,1,3>>,1,1]),
 2395:     % Compiler warnings due to constant evaluation expected (3)
 2396:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<1>>,1,1])),
 2397:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<>>,1,1])),
 2398:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[apa,1,1])),
 2399:     <<3,3>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<2,3,3>>,1,2]),
 2400:     % Constant propagation
 2401:      Bin = <<1,2,3>>,
 2402:      ok = if
 2403: 		    binary_part(Bin,1,1) =:= <<2>> ->
 2404: 			ok;
 2405: 		    %% Compiler warning, clause cannot match (expected)
 2406: 		    true ->
 2407: 			error
 2408: 		end,
 2409:      ok = if
 2410: 		    binary_part(Bin,{1,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
 2411: 			ok;
 2412: 		    %% Compiler warning, clause cannot match (expected)
 2413: 		    true ->
 2414: 			error
 2415: 		end,
 2416:     error = bp_coverage_1(id(<<>>)),
 2417: 
 2418:     ok.
 2419: 
 2420: 
 2421: bptest(B) when length(B) =:= 1337 ->
 2422:     1;
 2423: bptest(B) when binary_part(B,{1,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
 2424:     1;
 2425: bptest(B) when erlang:binary_part(B,1,1) =:= <<1>> ->
 2426:     2;
 2427: bptest(B)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{1,2}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 2428:     3;
 2429: bptest(_) ->
 2430:     error.
 2431: 
 2432: bptest(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
 2433:     1;
 2434: bptest(B,A) when binary_part(B,{A,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
 2435:     1;
 2436: bptest(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,A,1) =:= <<1>> ->
 2437:     2;
 2438: bptest(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{A,2}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 2439:     3;
 2440: bptest(_,_) ->
 2441:     error.
 2442: 
 2443: bptestx(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
 2444:     1;
 2445: bptestx(B,A) when binary_part(B,A) =:= <<2>> ->
 2446:     1;
 2447: bptestx(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,A) =:= <<1>> ->
 2448:     2;
 2449: bptestx(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,A) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 2450:     3;
 2451: bptestx(_,_) ->
 2452:     error.
 2453: 
 2454: bptesty(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
 2455:     1;
 2456: bptesty(B,A) when binary_part(B,{1,A}) =:= <<2>> ->
 2457:     1;
 2458: bptesty(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,1,A) =:= <<1>> ->
 2459:     2;
 2460: bptesty(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{1,A}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 2461:     3;
 2462: bptesty(_,_) ->
 2463:     error.
 2464: 
 2465: bptest(B,A,_C) when length(B) =:= A ->
 2466:     1;
 2467: bptest(B,A,C) when binary_part(B,{A,C}) =:= <<2>> ->
 2468:     1;
 2469: bptest(B,A,C) when erlang:binary_part(B,A,C) =:= <<1>> ->
 2470:     2;
 2471: bptest(B,A,C)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{A,C}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 2472:     3;
 2473: bptest(_,_,_) ->
 2474:     error.
 2475: 
 2476: bp_coverage_1(A) when binary_part(A, A, floor(float(0))) ->
 2477:     ok;
 2478: bp_coverage_1(_) ->
 2479:     error.
 2480: 
 2481: -define(FAILING(C),
 2482: 	if
 2483: 	    C -> ct:fail(should_fail);
 2484: 	    true -> ok
 2485: 	end,
 2486: 	if
 2487: 	    true, C -> ct:fail(should_fail);
 2488: 	    true -> ok
 2489: 	end).
 2490: 
 2491: bad_constants(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2492:     ?FAILING(false),
 2493:     ?FAILING([]),
 2494:     ?FAILING([a]),
 2495:     ?FAILING([Config]),
 2496:     ?FAILING({a,b}),
 2497:     ?FAILING({a,Config}),
 2498:     ?FAILING(<<1>>),
 2499:     ?FAILING(42),
 2500:     ?FAILING(3.14),
 2501:     ok.
 2502: 
 2503: bad_guards(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2504:     if erlang:float(self()); true -> ok end,
 2505: 
 2506:     fc(catch bad_guards_1(1, [])),
 2507:     fc(catch bad_guards_1(1, [2])),
 2508:     fc(catch bad_guards_1(atom, [2])),
 2509: 
 2510:     fc(catch bad_guards_2(#{a=>0,b=>0}, [])),
 2511:     fc(catch bad_guards_2(#{a=>0,b=>0}, [x])),
 2512:     fc(catch bad_guards_2(not_a_map, [x])),
 2513:     fc(catch bad_guards_2(42, [x])),
 2514: 
 2515:     fc(catch bad_guards_3(#{a=>0,b=>0}, [])),
 2516:     fc(catch bad_guards_3(#{a=>0,b=>0}, [x])),
 2517:     fc(catch bad_guards_3(not_a_map, [x])),
 2518:     fc(catch bad_guards_3(42, [x])),
 2519: 
 2520:     fc(catch bad_guards_4()),
 2521: 
 2522:     {0,undefined} = bad_guards_5(id(<<>>), id(undefined)),
 2523: 
 2524:     ok.
 2525: 
 2526: %% beam_bool used to produce GC BIF instructions whose
 2527: %% Live operands included uninitialized registers.
 2528: 
 2529: bad_guards_1(X, [_]) when {{X}}, -X ->
 2530:     ok.
 2531: 
 2532: bad_guards_2(M, [_]) when M#{a := 0, b => 0}, map_size(M) ->
 2533:     ok.
 2534: 
 2535: %% beam_type used to produce an GC BIF instruction whose Live operand
 2536: %% included uninitialized registers.
 2537: 
 2538: bad_guards_3(M, [_]) when is_map(M) andalso M#{a := 0, b => 0}, length(M) ->
 2539:     ok.
 2540: 
 2541: %% v3_codegen would generate a jump to the failure label, but
 2542: %% without initializing x(0). The code at the failure label expected
 2543: %% x(0) to be initialized.
 2544: 
 2545: bad_guards_4() when not (error#{}); {not 0.0} -> freedom.
 2546: 
 2547: %% The JIT used to segfault when a guard rem instruction failed
 2548: %% with badarith AND a bif had been called just before it.
 2549: bad_guards_5(A, B) ->
 2550:     {byte_size(A), undefined = bad_guards_5_1(B)}.
 2551: bad_guards_5_1(A) when is_integer(A rem 255) ->
 2552:     A rem 255;
 2553: bad_guards_5_1(_) ->
 2554:     undefined.
 2555: 
 2556: %% Building maps in a guard in a 'catch' would crash v3_codegen.
 2557: 
 2558: guard_in_catch(_Config) ->
 2559:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_map_1(#{}),
 2560:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_map_1(#{a=>b}),
 2561:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_map_1(atom),
 2562: 
 2563:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_map_2(#{}),
 2564:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_map_2(#{a=>b}),
 2565:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_map_2(atom),
 2566: 
 2567:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch do_guard_in_catch_map_3()),
 2568: 
 2569:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_bin(42),
 2570:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_bin(<<1,2,3>>),
 2571:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_bin(atom),
 2572:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_bin(#{}),
 2573: 
 2574:     ok.
 2575: 
 2576: do_guard_in_catch_map_1(From) ->
 2577:     catch
 2578: 	if
 2579: 	    From#{[] => sufficient} ->
 2580: 		saint
 2581: 	end.
 2582: 
 2583: do_guard_in_catch_map_2(From) ->
 2584:     catch
 2585: 	if
 2586: 	    From#{From => sufficient} ->
 2587: 		saint
 2588: 	end.
 2589: 
 2590: do_guard_in_catch_map_3() ->
 2591:     try
 2592: 	if [] -> solo end
 2593:     catch
 2594: 	Friendly when Friendly#{0 => []} -> minutes
 2595:     after
 2596: 	membership
 2597:     end.
 2598: 
 2599: do_guard_in_catch_bin(From) ->
 2600:     %% Would not crash v3_codegen, but there would be an unnecessary
 2601:     %% 'move' to a Y register.
 2602:     catch
 2603: 	if
 2604: 	    <<From:32>> ->
 2605: 		saint
 2606: 	end.
 2607: 
 2608: %%%
 2609: %%% The beam_bool pass has been eliminated. Here are the tests from
 2610: %%% beam_bool_SUITE, as well as new tests to test the new beam_ssa_bool
 2611: %%% module.
 2612: %%%
 2613: 
 2614: beam_bool_SUITE(_Config) ->
 2615:     before_and_inside_if(),
 2616:     scotland(),
 2617:     y_registers(),
 2618:     protected(),
 2619:     maps(),
 2620:     cover_shortcut_branches(),
 2621:     wrong_order(),
 2622:     megaco(),
 2623:     looks_like_a_guard(),
 2624:     fail_in_guard(),
 2625:     in_catch(),
 2626:     recv_semi(),
 2627:     andalso_repeated_var(),
 2628:     erl1246(),
 2629:     erl1253(),
 2630:     erl1384(),
 2631:     gh4788(),
 2632:     beam_ssa_bool_coverage(),
 2633:     bad_map_in_guard(),
 2634:     gh_6164(),
 2635:     gh_6184(),
 2636:     gh_7252(),
 2637:     gh_7339(),
 2638:     gh_7370(),
 2639:     gh_7517(),
 2640:     ok.
 2641: 
 2642: before_and_inside_if() ->
 2643:     no = before_and_inside_if([a], [b], delete),
 2644:     no = before_and_inside_if([a], [b], x),
 2645:     no = before_and_inside_if([a], [], delete),
 2646:     no = before_and_inside_if([a], [], x),
 2647:     no = before_and_inside_if([], [], delete),
 2648:     yes = before_and_inside_if([], [], x),
 2649:     yes = before_and_inside_if([], [b], delete),
 2650:     yes = before_and_inside_if([], [b], x),
 2651: 
 2652:     {ch1,ch2} = before_and_inside_if_2([a], [b], blah),
 2653:     {ch1,ch2} = before_and_inside_if_2([a], [b], xx),
 2654:     {ch1,ch2} = before_and_inside_if_2([a], [], blah),
 2655:     {ch1,ch2} = before_and_inside_if_2([a], [], xx),
 2656:     {no,no} = before_and_inside_if_2([], [b], blah),
 2657:     {no,no} = before_and_inside_if_2([], [b], xx),
 2658:     {ch1,no} = before_and_inside_if_2([], [], blah),
 2659:     {no,ch2} = before_and_inside_if_2([], [], xx),
 2660:     ok.
 2661: 
 2662: %% Thanks to Simon Cornish and Kostis Sagonas.
 2663: %% Used to crash beam_bool.
 2664: before_and_inside_if(XDo1, XDo2, Do3) ->
 2665:     Do1 = (XDo1 =/= []),
 2666:     Do2 = (XDo2 =/= []),
 2667:     if
 2668: 	%% This expression occurs in a try/catch (protected)
 2669: 	%% block, which cannot refer to variables outside of
 2670: 	%% the block that are boolean expressions.
 2671: 	Do1 =:= true;
 2672: 	Do1 =:= false, Do2 =:= false, Do3 =:= delete ->
 2673: 	    no;
 2674:        true ->
 2675: 	    yes
 2676:     end.
 2677: 
 2678: %% Thanks to Simon Cornish.
 2679: %% Used to generate code that would not set {y,0} on
 2680: %% all paths before its use (and therefore fail
 2681: %% validation by the beam_validator).
 2682: before_and_inside_if_2(XDo1, XDo2, Do3) ->
 2683:     Do1    = (XDo1 =/= []),
 2684:     Do2    = (XDo2 =/= []),
 2685:     CH1 = if Do1 == true;
 2686: 	     Do1 == false,Do2==false,Do3 == blah ->
 2687: 		  ch1;
 2688: 	     true ->
 2689: 		  no
 2690: 	  end,
 2691:     CH2 = if Do1 == true;
 2692: 	     Do1 == false,Do2==false,Do3 == xx ->
 2693: 		  ch2;
 2694: 	     true ->
 2695: 		  no
 2696: 	  end,
 2697:     {CH1,CH2}.
 2698: 
 2699: 
 2700: %% beam_bool would remove the initialization of {y,0}.
 2701: %% (Thanks to Thomas Arts and QuickCheck.)
 2702: 
 2703: scotland() ->
 2704:     million = do_scotland(placed),
 2705:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,placed},_}} = (catch do_scotland(false)),
 2706:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,placed},_}} = (catch do_scotland(true)),
 2707:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,placed},_}} = (catch do_scotland(echo)),
 2708:     ok.
 2709: 
 2710: do_scotland(Echo) ->
 2711:   found(case Echo of
 2712: 	    Echo when true; Echo, Echo, Echo ->
 2713: 		Echo;
 2714: 	    echo ->
 2715: 		[]
 2716: 	end,
 2717: 	Echo = placed).
 2718: 
 2719: found(_, _) -> million.
 2720: 
 2721: 
 2722: %% ERL-143: beam_bool could not handle Y registers as a destination.
 2723: y_registers() ->
 2724:     {'EXIT',{badarith,[_|_]}} = (catch baker(valentine)),
 2725:     {'EXIT',{badarith,[_|_]}} = (catch baker(clementine)),
 2726: 
 2727:     {not_ok,true} = potter([]),
 2728:     {ok,false} = potter([{encoding,any}]),
 2729: 
 2730:     ok.
 2731: 
 2732: %% Thanks to Quickcheck.
 2733: baker(Baker) ->
 2734:     (valentine == Baker) +
 2735: 	case Baker of
 2736: 	    Baker when Baker; Baker ->
 2737: 		Baker;
 2738: 	    Baker ->
 2739: 		[]
 2740: 	end.
 2741: 
 2742: %% Thanks to Jose Valim.
 2743: potter(Modes) ->
 2744:     Raw = lists:keyfind(encoding, 1, Modes) == false,
 2745:     Final = case Raw of
 2746: 		X when X == false; X == nil -> ok;
 2747: 		_ -> not_ok
 2748: 	    end,
 2749:     {Final,Raw}.
 2750: 
 2751: protected() ->
 2752:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch photographs({1, surprise, true}, opinions)),
 2753: 
 2754:     {{true}} = welcome({perfect, true}),
 2755:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch welcome({perfect, false})),
 2756:     ok.
 2757: 
 2758: photographs({_Violation, surprise, Deep}, opinions) ->
 2759:     {if
 2760: 	 0; "here", Deep ->
 2761: 	     Deep = Deep
 2762:      end}.
 2763: 
 2764: welcome({perfect, Profit}) ->
 2765:     if
 2766: 	Profit, Profit, Profit; 0 ->
 2767: 	    {id({Profit})}
 2768:     end.
 2769: 
 2770: maps() ->
 2771:     ok = evidence(#{0 => 42}).
 2772: 
 2773: %% Cover handling of put_map in in split_block_label_used/2.
 2774: evidence(#{0 := Charge}) when 0; #{[] => Charge} == #{[] => 42} ->
 2775:     ok.
 2776: 
 2777: cover_shortcut_branches() ->
 2778:     ok = cover_shortcut_branches({r1}, 0, 42, false),
 2779:     ok = cover_shortcut_branches({r1}, 42, 42, true),
 2780:     error = cover_shortcut_branches({r1}, same, same, false),
 2781:     error = cover_shortcut_branches({r1}, x, y, true),
 2782:     error = cover_shortcut_branches({r2}, 0, 42, false),
 2783:     error = cover_shortcut_branches({}, 0, 42, false),
 2784:     error = cover_shortcut_branches(not_tuple, 0, 42, false),
 2785:     ok.
 2786: 
 2787: cover_shortcut_branches(St, X, Y, Z) ->
 2788:     if
 2789:         %% The ((Y =:= X) =:= Z) part will test handling of a comparison
 2790:         %% operator followed by a one-way `br`.
 2791:         ((element(1, St) =:= r1) orelse fail) and ((Y =:= X) =:= Z) ->
 2792:             ok;
 2793:         true ->
 2794:             error
 2795:     end.
 2796: 
 2797: wrong_order() ->
 2798:     ok = wrong_order(repeat_until_fail, true),
 2799:     ok = wrong_order(repeat_until_fail, whatever),
 2800:     error = wrong_order(repeat_until_fail, false),
 2801:     error = wrong_order(nope, true),
 2802:     ok.
 2803: 
 2804: wrong_order(RepeatType, Mode) ->
 2805:     Parallel = Mode =/= false,
 2806:     RepeatStop = RepeatType =:= repeat_until_fail,
 2807:     if
 2808:         Parallel andalso RepeatStop ->
 2809:             ok;
 2810:         true ->
 2811:             error
 2812:     end.
 2813: 
 2814: megaco() ->
 2815:     ok = megaco('NULL', 0),
 2816:     ok = megaco('NULL', 7),
 2817:     ok = megaco('NULL', 15),
 2818:     ok = megaco('NULL', asn1_NOVALUE),
 2819:     ok = megaco(asn1_NOVALUE, 0),
 2820:     ok = megaco(asn1_NOVALUE, 7),
 2821:     ok = megaco(asn1_NOVALUE, 15),
 2822:     ok = megaco(asn1_NOVALUE, asn1_NOVALUE),
 2823: 
 2824:     error = megaco(bad, 0),
 2825:     error = megaco(bad, 7),
 2826:     error = megaco(bad, 15),
 2827:     error = megaco(bad, asn1_NOVALUE),
 2828: 
 2829:     error = megaco('NULL', not_integer),
 2830:     error = megaco('NULL', -1),
 2831:     error = megaco('NULL', 16),
 2832:     error = megaco(asn1_NOVALUE, not_integer),
 2833:     error = megaco(asn1_NOVALUE, -1),
 2834:     error = megaco(asn1_NOVALUE, 16),
 2835: 
 2836:     error = megaco(bad, bad),
 2837:     error = megaco(bad, -1),
 2838:     error = megaco(bad, 42),
 2839: 
 2840:     ok.
 2841: 
 2842: megaco(Top, SelPrio)
 2843:   when (Top =:= 'NULL' orelse Top =:= asn1_NOVALUE) andalso
 2844:        ((is_integer(SelPrio) andalso ((0 =< SelPrio) and (SelPrio =< 15))) orelse
 2845: 	SelPrio =:= asn1_NOVALUE) ->
 2846:     ok;
 2847: megaco(_, _) ->
 2848:     error.
 2849: 
 2850: %% ERL-1054.
 2851: looks_like_a_guard() ->
 2852:     ok = looks_like_a_guard(0),
 2853:     ok = looks_like_a_guard(1),
 2854:     ok.
 2855: 
 2856: looks_like_a_guard(N) ->
 2857:     GuessPosition = id(42),
 2858:     %% The matching of `true` would look like a guard to
 2859:     %% beam_ssa_bool. The optimized code would not be safe.
 2860:     case {1 >= N, GuessPosition == 0} of
 2861:         {true, _} -> ok;
 2862:         {_, true} -> ok;
 2863:         _ -> looks_like_a_guard(N)
 2864:     end.
 2865: 
 2866: -record(fail_in_guard, {f}).
 2867: fail_in_guard() ->
 2868:     false = struct_or_map(a, "foo"),
 2869:     false = struct_or_map(a, foo),
 2870:     false = struct_or_map(#{}, "foo"),
 2871:     true = struct_or_map(#{}, foo),
 2872: 
 2873:     false = (fun() when whatever =/= (program andalso []) -> true;
 2874:                 () -> false
 2875:              end)(),
 2876:     false = if whatever =/= (program orelse []) -> true;
 2877:                true -> false
 2878:             end,
 2879: 
 2880:     %% Would crash the compiler if optimizing passes
 2881:     %% were disabled.
 2882:     error = if
 2883:                 0.1 orelse "VZ", 42 -> ok;
 2884:                 true -> error
 2885:             end,
 2886:     error = (fun() when 3.14; <<[]:(ceil($D))>> -> ok;
 2887:                () -> error
 2888:             end)(),
 2889:     error = fun() when eye; ""#fail_in_guard.f andalso #{[] => true and false} ->
 2890:                     ok;
 2891:                () ->
 2892:                     error
 2893:             end(),
 2894:     error = fun() when (0 #fail_in_guard.f)#fail_in_guard.f -> ok;
 2895:                () -> error
 2896:             end(),
 2897:     error = fun() when 42; <<0.5,0:(element(true, false))>> ->
 2898:                     a = b;
 2899:                () -> error
 2900:             end(),
 2901: 
 2902:     ok.
 2903: 
 2904: %% ERL-1183. If Name is not an atom, the `fail` atom must cause the
 2905: %% entire guard to fail.
 2906: struct_or_map(Arg, Name) when
 2907:       (is_map(Arg) andalso (is_atom(Name) orelse fail) andalso
 2908:        is_map_key(struct, Arg)) orelse is_map(Arg) -> true;
 2909: struct_or_map(_Arg, _Name) ->
 2910:     false.
 2911: 
 2912: in_catch() ->
 2913:     ok = in_catch(true),
 2914:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,false},[_|_]}} = in_catch(false),
 2915:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[_|_]}} = in_catch(any),
 2916:     ok.
 2917: 
 2918: in_catch(V) ->
 2919:     catch
 2920:         case false or V of
 2921:             true -> ok
 2922:         end.
 2923: 
 2924: recv_semi() ->
 2925:     timeout = id(receive
 2926:                      ok when home; <<(m#{}):false>> ->
 2927:                          ok
 2928:                  after 0 ->
 2929:                          timeout
 2930:                  end).
 2931: 
 2932: andalso_repeated_var() ->
 2933:     ok = andalso_repeated_var(true),
 2934:     error = andalso_repeated_var(false),
 2935:     error = andalso_repeated_var([not_boolean]),
 2936:     ok.
 2937: 
 2938: andalso_repeated_var(B) when B andalso B -> ok;
 2939: andalso_repeated_var(_) -> error.
 2940: 
 2941: -record(erl1246, {tran_stat = 0}).
 2942: 
 2943: erl1246() ->
 2944:     false = erl1246(#erl1246{tran_stat = 0}, #{cid => 1131}),
 2945:     false = erl1246(#erl1246{tran_stat = 12}, #{cid => 1131}),
 2946:     false = erl1246(#erl1246{tran_stat = 12}, #{cid => 9502}),
 2947:     true = erl1246(#erl1246{tran_stat = 0}, #{cid => 9502}),
 2948:     ok.
 2949: 
 2950: erl1246(Rec, #{cid := CollID}) ->
 2951:     {GiftCollID, _} = erl1246_conf(gift_coll),
 2952:     IsTranStat = Rec#erl1246.tran_stat =:= erl1246_conf(transform_id),
 2953:     if
 2954:         %% Optimization of 'not' in a guard was broken.
 2955:         CollID =:= GiftCollID andalso not IsTranStat ->
 2956:             true;
 2957:         true ->
 2958:             false
 2959:     end.
 2960: 
 2961: erl1246_conf(gift_coll) -> {9502, {112, 45}};
 2962: erl1246_conf(transform_id) -> 12;
 2963: erl1246_conf(_) -> undefined.
 2964: 
 2965: erl1253() ->
 2966:     ok = erl1253_orelse_false(a, a, any),
 2967:     ok = erl1253_orelse_false(a, a, true),
 2968:     ok = erl1253_orelse_false(a, a, false),
 2969:     error = erl1253_orelse_false(a, b, any),
 2970:     error = erl1253_orelse_false(a, b, true),
 2971:     ok = erl1253_orelse_false(a, b, false),
 2972: 
 2973:     ok = erl1253_orelse_true(a, a, any),
 2974:     ok = erl1253_orelse_true(a, a, true),
 2975:     ok = erl1253_orelse_true(a, a, false),
 2976:     error = erl1253_orelse_true(a, b, any),
 2977:     ok = erl1253_orelse_true(a, b, true),
 2978:     error = erl1253_orelse_true(a, b, false),
 2979: 
 2980:     error = erl1253_andalso_false(a, a, any),
 2981:     error = erl1253_andalso_false(a, a, true),
 2982:     ok = erl1253_andalso_false(a, a, false),
 2983:     error = erl1253_andalso_false(a, b, any),
 2984:     error = erl1253_andalso_false(a, b, true),
 2985:     error = erl1253_andalso_false(a, b, false),
 2986: 
 2987:     error = erl1253_andalso_true(a, a, any),
 2988:     ok = erl1253_andalso_true(a, a, true),
 2989:     error = erl1253_andalso_true(a, a, false),
 2990:     error = erl1253_andalso_true(a, b, any),
 2991:     error = erl1253_andalso_true(a, b, true),
 2992:     error = erl1253_andalso_true(a, b, false),
 2993: 
 2994:     ok.
 2995: 
 2996: erl1253_orelse_false(X, Y, Z) ->
 2997:     Res = erl1253_orelse_false_1(X, Y, Z),
 2998:     Res = erl1253_orelse_false_2(X, Y, Z),
 2999:     Res = erl1253_orelse_false_3(X, Y, Z).
 3000: 
 3001: erl1253_orelse_false_1(X, Y, Z) ->
 3002:     Bool = Z =:= false,
 3003:     if
 3004:         X =:= Y orelse Bool -> ok;
 3005:         true -> error
 3006:     end.
 3007: 
 3008: erl1253_orelse_false_2(X, Y, Z) ->
 3009:     Bool = Z =:= false,
 3010:     if
 3011:         Bool orelse X =:= Y -> ok;
 3012:         true -> error
 3013:     end.
 3014: 
 3015: erl1253_orelse_false_3(X, Y, Z) ->
 3016:     Bool1 = X =:= Y,
 3017:     Bool2 = Z =:= false,
 3018:     if
 3019:         Bool1 orelse Bool2 -> ok;
 3020:         true -> error
 3021:     end.
 3022: 
 3023: erl1253_orelse_true(X, Y, Z) ->
 3024:     Res = erl1253_orelse_true_1(X, Y, Z),
 3025:     Res = erl1253_orelse_true_2(X, Y, Z),
 3026:     Res = erl1253_orelse_true_3(X, Y, Z).
 3027: 
 3028: erl1253_orelse_true_1(X, Y, Z)   ->
 3029:     Bool = Z =:= true,
 3030:     if
 3031:         X =:= Y orelse Bool -> ok;
 3032:         true -> error
 3033:     end.
 3034: 
 3035: erl1253_orelse_true_2(X, Y, Z) ->
 3036:     Bool = Z =:= true,
 3037:     if
 3038:         Bool orelse X =:= Y -> ok;
 3039:         true -> error
 3040:     end.
 3041: 
 3042: erl1253_orelse_true_3(X, Y, Z)   ->
 3043:     Bool1 = X =:= Y,
 3044:     Bool2 = Z =:= true,
 3045:     if
 3046:         Bool1 orelse Bool2 -> ok;
 3047:         true -> error
 3048:     end.
 3049: 
 3050: erl1253_andalso_false(X, Y, Z) ->
 3051:     Res = erl1253_andalso_false_1(X, Y, Z),
 3052:     Res = erl1253_andalso_false_2(X, Y, Z),
 3053:     Res = erl1253_andalso_false_3(X, Y, Z).
 3054: 
 3055: erl1253_andalso_false_1(X, Y, Z) ->
 3056:     Bool = Z =:= false,
 3057:     if
 3058:         X =:= Y andalso Bool -> ok;
 3059:         true -> error
 3060:     end.
 3061: 
 3062: erl1253_andalso_false_2(X, Y, Z) ->
 3063:     Bool1 = X =:= Y,
 3064:     Bool2 = Z =:= false,
 3065:     if
 3066:         Bool1 andalso Bool2 -> ok;
 3067:         true -> error
 3068:     end.
 3069: 
 3070: erl1253_andalso_false_3(X, Y, Z) ->
 3071:     Bool1 = X =:= Y,
 3072:     Bool2 = Z =:= false,
 3073:     if
 3074:         Bool1 andalso Bool2 -> ok;
 3075:         true -> error
 3076:     end.
 3077: 
 3078: erl1253_andalso_true(X, Y, Z) ->
 3079:     Res = erl1253_andalso_true_1(X, Y, Z),
 3080:     Res = erl1253_andalso_true_2(X, Y, Z),
 3081:     Res = erl1253_andalso_true_3(X, Y, Z).
 3082: 
 3083: erl1253_andalso_true_1(X, Y, Z) ->
 3084:     Bool = Z =:= true,
 3085:     if
 3086:         X =:= Y andalso Bool -> ok;
 3087:         true -> error
 3088:     end.
 3089: 
 3090: erl1253_andalso_true_2(X, Y, Z) ->
 3091:     Bool = Z =:= true,
 3092:     if
 3093:         Bool andalso X =:= Y-> ok;
 3094:         true -> error
 3095:     end.
 3096: 
 3097: erl1253_andalso_true_3(X, Y, Z) ->
 3098:     Bool1 = X =:= Y,
 3099:     Bool2 = Z =:= true,
 3100:     if
 3101:         Bool1 andalso Bool2 -> ok;
 3102:         true -> error
 3103:     end.

 3105: erl1384() ->
 3106:     gurka = erl1384_1(id(a)),
 3107:     gaffel = erl1384_1(id(b)),
 3108:     ok.
 3109: 
 3110: erl1384_1(V) ->
 3111:     case {id(false), V =/= a} of
 3112:         {true, true} -> not_reachable;
 3113:         {_, false} -> gurka;
 3114:         _ -> gaffel
 3115:     end.
 3116: 
 3117: gh4788() ->
 3118:     ok = do_gh4788(id(0)),
 3119:     ok = do_gh4788(id(1)),
 3120:     ok = do_gh4788(id(undefined)),
 3121:     lt_0_or_undefined = catch do_gh4788(id(-1)),
 3122:     ok.
 3123: 
 3124: do_gh4788(N) ->
 3125:     %% beam_ssa_bool would do an unsafe optimization when run after
 3126:     %% the beam_ssa_share pass.
 3127:     case {N >= 0, N == undefined} of
 3128:         {true, _} -> ok;
 3129:         {_, true} -> ok;
 3130:         _ -> throw(lt_0_or_undefined)
 3131:     end,
 3132:     ok.
 3133: 
 3134: beam_ssa_bool_coverage() ->
 3135:     {"*","abc"} = collect_modifiers("abc*", []),
 3136:     error = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_1(true),
 3137: 
 3138:     ok = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_2(self()),
 3139:     ok = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_2(true),
 3140:     error = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_2(false),
 3141:     error = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_2(42),
 3142: 
 3143:     ok.
 3144: 
 3145: collect_modifiers([H | T], Buffer)
 3146:     when (H >= $a andalso H =< $z) or
 3147:          (H >= $A andalso H =< $Z) ->
 3148:     collect_modifiers(T, [H | Buffer]);
 3149: collect_modifiers(Rest, Buffer) ->
 3150:     {Rest, lists:reverse(Buffer)}.
 3151: 
 3152: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_1(V) when V andalso 0, tuple_size(0) ->
 3153:     ok;
 3154: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_1(_) ->
 3155:     error.
 3156: 
 3157: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_2(A) when is_pid(A) andalso true; A ->
 3158:     ok;
 3159: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_2(_) ->
 3160:     error.
 3161:

 3165: 
 3166:     ok.

 3169:     case 42 of
 3170:         V2 ->
 3171:             case is_list(V1) of
 3172:                 V3 ->
 3173:                     case V3 orelse V2 of
 3174:                         _ when V3 -> 100
 3175:                     end =< V3
 3176:             end
 3177:     end.

 3213:

 3216:     foo;

 3218:     bar.

 3221:     foo;

 3261: repeated_type_tests(_Config) ->
 3262:     binary = repeated_type_test(<<42>>),
 3263:     bitstring = repeated_type_test(<<1:1>>),
 3264:     other = repeated_type_test(atom),
 3265:     ok.
 3266: 
 3267: repeated_type_test(T) ->
 3268:     %% Test for a bug in beam_ssa_dead.
 3269:     if is_bitstring(T) ->
 3270:             if is_binary(T) ->                  %This test would be optimized away.
 3271:                     binary;
 3272:                true ->
 3273:                     bitstring
 3274:             end;
 3275:        true ->
 3276:             other
 3277:     end.
 3278: 
 3279: %% ERL-1179: The result of '=/=' would be flipped if it was used after being
 3280: %% branched on.
 3281: use_after_branch(_Config) ->
 3282:     {false, gaffel} = use_after_branch_1(foo),
 3283:     {true, gurka} = use_after_branch_1(bar),
 3284:     ok.
 3285: 
 3286: use_after_branch_1(A) ->
 3287:     Boolean = A =/= foo,
 3288:     case Boolean of
 3289:         true -> id(something);
 3290:         false -> id(other)
 3291:     end,
 3292:     case Boolean of
 3293:         true -> {id(Boolean), gurka};
 3294:         false -> {id(Boolean), gaffel}
 3295:     end.
 3296: 
 3297: %% Call this function to turn off constant propagation.
 3298: id(I) -> I.
 3299: 
 3300: check(F, Result) ->
 3301:     case F() of
 3302: 	Result -> ok;
 3303: 	Other ->
 3304: 	    io:format("Expected: ~p\n", [Result]),
 3305: 	    io:format("     Got: ~p\n", [Other]),
 3306: 	    ct:fail(check_failed)
 3307:     end.
 3308: 
 3309: fc({'EXIT',{function_clause,_}}) -> ok.
